name: SWIFT Customer Security Controls Framework (CSCF) v2025
description: Swift CSCF v2025 defines mandatory and advisory controls to secure Swift users’ environments across three objectives: secure your environment; know and limit access; and detect and respond.
authority: SWIFT (Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication)

controls.title: Swift Environment Protection
controls.description: Swift-related systems are hosted in a segregated secure zone with tightly controlled, logged and monitored communications to reduce exposure to the general IT environment.

controls.title: Operating System Privileged Account Control
controls.description: Privileged accounts on in-scope systems are minimised, uniquely attributable, strongly authenticated and monitored to prevent misuse.

controls.title: Virtualisation or Cloud Platform Protection
controls.description: Virtualisation or cloud platforms hosting Swift components are securely configured and isolated so that tenants and workloads cannot compromise Swift-related systems.

controls.title: Restriction of Internet Access
controls.description: Direct internet access from Swift-related systems is prohibited; only explicitly authorised, filtered and monitored egress is allowed via controlled proxies or gateways.

controls.title: Customer Environment Protection
controls.description: Adjacent customer environments interacting with Swift components are protected with layered controls so compromise cannot propagate into the Swift secure zone.

controls.title: Internal Data Flow Security
controls.description: Confidentiality, integrity and authentication are applied to Swift component‑to‑component data flows (for example LAU with encryption or mutual TLS).

controls.title: Security Updates
controls.description: Security patches and firmware updates for in‑scope components are evaluated, prioritised and applied in a timely manner to mitigate known vulnerabilities.

controls.title: System Hardening
controls.description: In‑scope systems are hardened to a defined baseline by removing unnecessary services, restricting configurations and enforcing secure parameters.

controls.title: Back Office Data Flow Security
controls.description: Data flows between Swift secure zone and back‑office first hops are identified and protected by design (for example end‑to‑end protection or secured bridging servers).

controls.title: External Transmission Data Protection
controls.description: Confidentiality, integrity and authenticity are ensured for Swift‑related data transmitted over external or untrusted networks.

controls.title: Operator Session Confidentiality and Integrity
controls.description: Operator sessions to Swift components are protected against eavesdropping and tampering using secure protocols and strong session controls.

controls.title: Vulnerability Scanning
controls.description: Regular vulnerability assessments are performed at OS and application layers with risk‑based remediation and verification of fixes.

controls.title: Outsourced Critical Activity Protection
controls.description: Outsourced Swift‑related activities are governed by contracts and controls that ensure equivalent security, with oversight of providers and their sub‑providers.

controls.title: Transaction Business Controls
controls.description: Business controls (for example approvals, limits, sanctions and anomaly checks) mitigate the risk of unauthorised or fraudulent Swift transactions.

controls.title: Application Hardening
controls.description: Swift‑related applications are developed or configured following secure development and hardening practices to resist common attacks.

controls.title: RMA Business Controls
controls.description: Relationship Management Application (RMA) permissions are reviewed and governed so business relationships and message exchanges remain authorised and appropriate.

controls.title: Physical Security
controls.description: Facilities housing Swift components implement perimeter, access control, monitoring and environmental protections to prevent unauthorised physical access or damage.

controls.title: Password Policy
controls.description: Passwords and passphrases meet defined complexity, lifecycle and reuse requirements and are protected in storage and transit.

controls.title: Multi-Factor Authentication
controls.description: MFA is enforced for operator and administrative access to Swift‑related systems and supporting services.

controls.title: Logical Access Control
controls.description: Logical access to Swift‑related systems follows least‑privilege, need‑to‑know and segregation‑of‑duties principles with regular access reviews.

controls.title: Token Management
controls.description: Cryptographic tokens and keys used by Swift components are generated, stored, rotated and revoked under secure lifecycle management.

controls.title: Staff Screening Process
controls.description: Personnel with Swift access undergo background screening proportionate to role sensitivity and applicable laws.

controls.title: Password Repository Protection
controls.description: Any password or secret repository used for Swift operations is hardened, access‑controlled, encrypted and monitored.

controls.title: Malware Protection
controls.description: Anti‑malware and endpoint protection controls (EPP/EDR/XDR) are deployed and updated to detect, prevent and respond to malicious code on in‑scope systems.

controls.title: Software Integrity
controls.description: Only trusted, verified software and updates are installed; code integrity and signing are enforced to prevent tampering.

controls.title: Database Integrity
controls.description: Databases that store Swift‑related data implement integrity controls, secure configurations and monitoring to prevent unauthorised alteration.

controls.title: Logging and Monitoring
controls.description: Security‑relevant events from Swift‑related systems are logged, protected, correlated and monitored to detect anomalous activity and support investigations.

controls.title: Intrusion Detection
controls.description: Network and/or host intrusion detection is in place for secure zones to identify abnormal activity and trigger response.

controls.title: Cyber Incident Response Planning
controls.description: A defined and tested cyber incident response plan exists, covering notification, containment, recovery and information sharing with Swift and regulators as applicable.

controls.title: Security Training and Awareness
controls.description: Staff with Swift access receive regular security awareness and role‑based training, including for privileged users.

controls.title: Penetration Testing
controls.description: Periodic penetration testing exercises validate the effectiveness of controls protecting Swift environments and drive remediation.

controls.title: Scenario-based Risk Assessment
controls.description: Threat‑led scenarios are used to assess risks (for example ransomware or third‑party compromise) and to prioritise resilience improvements.
